title: Ninurta temple (Khorsabad)
description: As part of the palatial complex of Dūr-Šarrukīn (modern Khorsabad), the eighth-century-BC Assyrian king Sargon II (r. 721–705 BC) constructed six temples, including one to the god Ninurta.

properties.description: Representative point based on the visible remains of the Ninurta temple.
properties.title: Representative location of the Ninurta temple
